docs.title: 👋 Welcome to my PyCon Thailand Workshop
docs.text:
By Michelle Sandford From Microsoft Asia

Explore the journey through Imposter Syndrome and out the other side! Discover your strengths as a Pythonista. Navigate each chapter to learn, reflect, and grow!

docs.title: 📚 Chapters
docs.text:
• Imposter Syndrome - Understanding the doubts we all face
  • The Expert - You don't need to know everything
  • The Perfectionist - Progress over perfection
  • The Superperson - Balance is key
  • The Natural Genius - Learning takes time
  • The Soloist - Collaboration is strength
  • Key Takeaways - What we've learned
  • Resources - Continue your journey
  • Contact Page - Stay connected

docs.title: 🚀 Get Started
docs.text: Select a chapter from the navigation to begin your workshop journey.

docs.title: 💬 Get in Touch
docs.text: We'd love to hear from you! For questions, feedback, or collaboration opportunities, reach out:

docs.title: 🌐 Social Media
docs.text:
• LinkTree: Codess_aus
  • BlueSky: codess-aus.bsky.social
  • LinkedIn: Michelle Sandford
  • GitHub: Codess-AUS
  • YouTube: Michelle Sandford
  • TikTok: Codess_Aus

docs.title: 🤝 Join the Community
docs.text: Connect with fellow Pythonistas: - Attend PyCon Thailand - Join local Python meetups - Participate in online discussions - Share your story and help others

docs.title: 🙏 Thank You!
docs.text:
Thank you for joining the No Turning Back workshop at PyCon Thailand!

Remember: You are capable, you are learning, and you belong in this community.

Keep coding! 🐍💜

docs.title: 😨 Imposter Syndrome
docs.text: Imposter Syndrome is the feeling that you don't belong or aren't good enough, even when you are! Many Pythonistas experience this at some point in their journey.

docs.title: 💡 What is Imposter Syndrome?
docs.text: Imposter Syndrome is a psychological pattern where individuals doubt their accomplishments and fear being exposed as a "fraud." It can affect anyone, regardless of experience or skill level.

docs.title: 🛠️ How to Overcome
docs.text:
• Recognize your achievements - Keep a success journal
  • Talk to peers and mentors - Share your feelings openly
  • Celebrate small wins - Every step forward matters
  • Remember: You are not alone! - This affects up to 70% of people

docs.title: 🎯 What We've Learned
docs.text:
• Everyone experiences doubts—it's normal! Up to 70% of people experience imposter syndrome at some point
  • Growth comes from learning and sharing - Teaching others reinforces your own knowledge
  • Progress is more important than perfection - Done is better than perfect
  • Community support makes a difference - You're never alone in this journey
  • Balance is essential - Take care of yourself while pursuing your goals
  • Learning takes time - Be patient with yourself

docs.title: 💪 Moving Forward
docs.text: Remember: - You belong here - Your unique perspective matters - Ask for help - It's a sign of wisdom, not weakness - Celebrate wins - Big and small achievements deserve recognition - Keep coding - Every line of code is progress

docs.title: 📚 Continue Learning
docs.text: Explore resources and connect with others to keep growing.

docs.title: 🌐 Python Community
docs.text:
• PyCon Thailand - Join us at the conference!
  • Python.org - Official Python documentation
  • Python Discord - Active community with thousands of members

docs.title: 📖 Learning Resources
docs.text:
• Real Python - In-depth tutorials and articles
  • Talk Python - Podcast covering Python topics
  • Python Weekly - Newsletter with curated content
  • Awesome Python - Curated list of Python frameworks and libraries

docs.title: 💡 Imposter Syndrome Resources
docs.text:
• The Secret Thoughts of Successful Women - Valarie Young's book on imposter syndrome
  • Feel Like a Fraud? - APA article on imposter syndrome
  • Impostor Syndrome at Work - Harvard Business Review

docs.title: 🧑‍🏫 The Expert
docs.text: The Expert feels they must know everything about Python and answer every question. This mindset can lead to stress and burnout.

docs.title: 🧠 Why It Happens
docs.text:
Experts often set high standards for themselves and fear being seen as less knowledgeable. They believe they need to know everything before they can contribute or teach others.

"The more I learn, the more I realize how much I don't know." - Albert Einstein

docs.title: 🌱 Growth Mindset
docs.text:
• Embrace learning as a journey - There's always something new to discover
  • Ask questions and seek help - It's a sign of strength, not weakness
  • Share knowledge with others - Teaching reinforces your own learning
  • It's okay to say "I don't know" - Then add "but let's find out together"

docs.title: 🧠 The Natural Genius
docs.text: The Natural Genius expects to master new skills quickly. When learning takes time, they may feel discouraged.

docs.title: 🌟 Embrace the Process
docs.text:
• Learning takes time and effort - Even "naturals" practice extensively
  • Celebrate progress, not perfection - Small improvements compound over time
  • Everyone learns at their own pace - Your journey is unique
  • Struggle is part of growth - Challenges make you stronger
  • Focus on the journey - Enjoy the process of discovery

"It's not that I'm so smart, it's just that I stay with problems longer." - Albert Einstein

docs.title: 🎯 The Perfectionist
docs.text: The Perfectionist strives for flawless code and never feels satisfied. This can slow progress and increase frustration.

docs.title: 🏆 Embracing Imperfection
docs.text:
• Mistakes are part of learning - Each bug teaches you something new
  • Progress over perfection - Done is better than perfect
  • Review and refactor, but don't obsess - Set time limits for improvements
  • Ship it! - Real-world feedback is more valuable than theoretical perfection

"Perfect is the enemy of good." - Voltaire

docs.title: 🏃 The Soloist
docs.text: The Soloist prefers to work alone and may hesitate to ask for help. Collaboration is key to growth!

docs.title: 🤝 Collaborate and Connect
docs.text:
• Ask for help when needed - It speeds up learning and builds relationships
  • Join Python communities - PyCon Thailand, Discord, local meetups
  • Share your journey with others - Your struggles help others feel less alone
  • Pair programming - Two heads are better than one
  • Contribute to open source - Learn from others and give back

"If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together." - African Proverb

docs.title: 🦸 The Superperson
docs.text: The Superperson tries to do it all—coding, teaching, leading, and more. This can lead to exhaustion and feeling overwhelmed.

docs.title: 🧩 Finding Balance
docs.text:
• Delegate tasks when possible - You don't have to do everything alone
  • Set realistic goals - Focus on what truly matters
  • Take breaks and recharge - Burnout helps no one
  • Know your limits - It's okay to say no sometimes
  • Prioritize self-care - Your wellbeing comes first

"You can do anything, but not everything." - David Allen
